title: sushi good (not great), take outs served before table guests
text: Disappointing. We were there on a reservation for a birthday dinner, party of 6. Appetizers were served quickly. Tempura veggies were bland, as was dipping broth served with them. Sushi was good but far from the best I've had. Staff seemed very disorganized. It took a ridiculously long time to get our sushi. After the third person in our group asked about the delay we were advised they had "a lot of take out orders". I would think the guests who are actually IN your restaurant would be your priority. Also they did nothing to recognize the birthday.

title: exceptional meal!
text: I only wish we had found this spot earlier in our trip so we could try ALL of their dishes! Staff was so welcoming and attentive! Beautiful spot on the beach!

title: fresh and delicious!
text: One of the best meals we had in Greece! Staff is very welcoming! Ginger mojito is a must-try! Lovely and quiet location for lunch!

title: good food and drink
text: This spot was close to our Airbnb and we liked the neighborhood feel. Food was very good although more pricey than many similar meals we had. Our mixed drinks house cocktails whose names I cannot recall- one alcoholic and one not- were most excellent!

title: hidden gem!
text: This building is gorgeous and the collection is outstanding! Lovely, cool respite from the touristy street!

title: beautiful spot
text: Lovely during the day and enchanting at night! Shops and restaurants right on the harbor are quite touristy; we found the best meals a few blocks back.

title: bad food and service
text: Not sure where all of these good reviews are coming from! We ate our most expensive and worst tasting meal here. Almost everything on their grilled seafood platter was flavorless and oddly textured. The wait staff never stopped back to ask how the food was, which would have been obvious to a good waiter after seeing how much food we left on the platter. It's in a beautiful spot on the harbor, but DON'T waste your money here!

title: Sunset cruise
text: My sister and I enjoyed the relaxed sunset cruise. Raki and fruit were a nice treat and all of the staff we encountered were very friendly. Beautiful spot to enjoy and photograph the sunset, and lovely to see the harbor all lit up on our journey back to the dock. One large concern tho - when I asked where the life jackets were located, well into the cruise, the response I received was "why, are you afraid?". I realize that this was a short cruise just into the harbor, but I have NEVER been on any type of boating activity during which the crew didn't give at least a brief safety presentation.Also, never saw a life jacket!

title: Delicious and inexpensive
text: We had a great meal here! Good service, open kitchen so fun to watch them cooking, nice relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. Had chickpea quinoa salad, chicken tikka, roti, and one beer for 20 euros. More than enough delicious food for the 2 of us!

title: Unplanned delight
text: On the way to the Amalia hotel pickup for a different 2 day tour my sister's passport was stolen on the metro. We are so grateful to Chat tours for rescheduling us for this tour later that day, and another to Delphi the next day! And for their assistance in obtaining a new passport. This tour was well organized, Dora our guide was lovely. We enjoyed the scenic drive along the coast and the beautifully dramatic location of the temple! We felt we had just the right amount of time to explore and absorb the history! On a side note, after reading other reviews I would definitely recommend meeting any tour at the Amalia if at all possible, rather than being picked up elsewhere. Why make the pickup rounds on the bus when you can be walking around Athens seeing other sites? We found Athens to be much more compact than we thought it would be.
place: Cape Sounion and Temple of Poseidon Half-Day Trip from Athens

title: Must see!
text: I can't imagine being in Athens without going here! Spectacular site, awesome views! We arrived midmorning on 21 September; crowded but not unbearably so. It was very breezy that day and we witnessed several people losing their hats! Wear sturdy shoes with good grip- some spots can be quite slippery. Loved that we could spend as much time there as we wanted. We visited the museum the day before and definitely recommend doing so before your visit here.

title: Incredible! Visit before the acropolis
text: Beautiful museum with a great collection! Definitely recommend a visit here before touring the acropolis to obtain a good knowledge base!

title: Highlight of our trip to Greece
text: On the way to the hotel pick up location for a 2 day tour my sister's passport was stolen on the metro so we had to cancel that tour. We are SO grateful to Chat tours for immediately rescheduling us on 2 other tours, including this one! And for their assistance with obtaining a new passport. Delphi is an amazing place to visit and our tour was made even better by our guide Effie. She shared her extensive knowledge clearly and with delightful wit, even during the bus ride there and back! Loved the Delphi museum visit!! We felt totally safe in the hands of our driver. Lunch was very good with large portions.This tour was definitely a highlight of our trip to Greece.

title: fun tour!
text: We booked this tour as part of an 85th birthday celebration. All 5 of the adults enjoyed it. It was so fun to be UNDER that bridge for once! Love that this is a family company - all of them were super nice and knowledgeable!

title: wow
text: I think this is something that everyone who comes to Brighton should see, So interesting! Love the history. Magnificent place and beautiful gardens.

title: best breakfast in Brighton!
text: Our first time here, Suzie and Telly are the best hosts! We felt spoiled at breakfast; loved the open kitchen/eating space! Complimentary bar was such a nice extra! When we arrived back one late afternoon we were greeted by delicious biscuits with cream and jam in the dining room. Our room was so lovely and clean, with a super comfy bed, tea/coffee/treats. Location makes for easy walk to Pier area. We would definitely recommend this B&B!!

title: cheap and greasy!
text: My boyfriend thought their fish was one of the best he had during our England trip, and the price was right! I thought it was terribly greasy.

title: pie and a pint special
text: Good beer selection, we enjoyed their "pie and a pint" wednesday night special. Quite good food for the price.

title: Great stay near Gatwick
text: Room was clean, spacious; bed very comfy. Karen and Colin were great hosts, as was their greeter dog Montie! Karen was very attentive during breakfast, even tho we had opted for the continental only. Easy walk to shops/good restaurants in Horley .Super easy and inexpensive taxi ride from airport. I would definitely stay here again when flying through Gatwick.

title: clean and super friendly
text: We stayed here for one night and would definitely stay again if in the area. Close to the expressway and really easy to get to downtown Marietta from the hotel. Our room and bathroom were obviously well maintained and clean. Good free coffee in the lobby all day. We went out for breakfast but did see the "continental"/ buffet which looked a bit above average. Comfy bed and pillows. Every staff person we encountered was super friendly and pleasant!
place: Microtel Inn & Suites by Wyndham Marietta

title: good one night stay
text: Room was clean, staff were friendly. It was what we expected for a Super 8; no big complaints. Gallipolis is a cool river town,wish we had more time to explore it; we did enjoy a view of the bridge from our room.
place: Super 8 by Wyndham Gallipolis Pt Pleasant Area

title: unexpected delight!
text: Went here on advice of hotel staff. We were a bit skeptical when we saw the generic building exterior and the laminated menu but this place was great! Very friendly waitress. The food was delicious and the portions were LARGE! Warning: you should plan to share if you don't want to take leftovers home. We both had enough left over to enjoy for dinner the next day!

title: "There's a story about that..."
text: My mother (78) and I(53) went on the 6 day railtour and had a great time! Don't usually go for tours but thought this would be a good way to get a feel for our first time there. The 6 day tour is actually a combination of several shorter tours, so we got to meet new travelers and guides during the trip - fun! LOVED that we saw so many BEAUTIFUL places in one trip, and we have special memories from each of them. We did need to catch up on our rest after returning home, tho! All of the guides were good, but our favorite was our guide for the first few days, Brandon. He shared so much of his knowledge, was attentive to everyone's needs, and was just an all-around pleasure! Many times as we were riding in a coach he would point something out and say "there's a story about that...." and proceed to share the story - always entertaining! His love for the culture and history of Ireland was evident. Thanks again Brandon!
place: Railtours Ireland First Class - Day Tours

title: Cozy and delicious
text: Enjoyed dinner here before heading across the street for music at Leeson Lounge. Both my lamb kafta and mom's hake were delicious. Good service, wine and atmosphere completed our lovely experience here!

title: Los Paradiso!
text: Visited this neighborhood place upon recommendation from a guitar shop owner, specifically to hear the band Los Paradiso on a Wednesday evening. Nice "local" feel and the band was great! Drinks were reasonably priced, staff was welcoming. Just wish they would have stayed open a bit later. Check to make sure the band is playing before you visit! Also enjoyed dinner at Canal Bank Cafe across the street.

title: food and fun!
text: Lively atmosphere, good food and drinks, live music - what's not to love? My mother (78 years young) and I had a great dinner here with some new friends we met on our walk there. Loved the mixed crowd!

title: good location, TINY shower
text: Hotel was centrally located, so easy to get to via bus from airport and great for sightseeing in the city. Room was nice enough, small and clean but the shower was TINY. An obese person could seriously not fit into it! Expect street noise; nice that they provide ear plugs! Ask to NOT be in a room on the alley side as it sounded like beer keg bowling every morning! Each staff member we met was friendly. The lift was out of service when we checked in so they kindly insisted on carrying our luggage upstairs for us.

title: very nice hotel
text: We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a tour package, and had booked an additional night prior to travel. Annoyingly, we were not allowed to stay in the same room for the third night, apparently because of the price difference of which I was unaware at time of booking. I asked to remain in the less expensive room for the third night and to receive partial reimbursement but this request was denied. I must say that both rooms were comfortable and clean, but the "non-tour" room was gorgeous! Spa luxury type bath as well! Wouldn't say the hotel location was excellent but it was easy to get around town on public transportation from there. Buffet breakfast was GRAND! Every staff member we encountered was friendly.

title: loved the lesson on how to make a proper Irish coffee
text: This was a fun evening, like visiting Dublin with a friend who knows the good places to go. This was my first food tour, so I can't compare to similar tours. I liked that we experienced what I would call "modernized traditional" Irish food. At our last stop we had a lesson on how to properly make (and drink!) an Irish coffee, which was great! Our guide was friendly and shared some great knowledge of Dublin city and the food scene there. Also fun to meet others on the tour from all around the world. Very impressed with attention paid to food sensitivities of some in the group as well.

title: great room and breakfast, go somewhere else for dinner
text: We stayed here as part of a tour so the hotel was chosen for us. The room was very nice and clean. Their breakfast buffet was great. Due to bad weather we opted to stay in for dinner one night - bad idea. Food was pricey and average, waitress was not good. Hotel is easy walk to downtown area. All other hotel staff were fine.

title: Not impressed
text: Penne pasta was huge portion but bland sauce and what tasted like canned chicken. Couldn't eat it all but wouldn't want to! Aubergine boat was tasty but served with bland rice. We chose this place based on menu out front but wish we hadn't. Staff were friendly enough but overall not impressed.

title: overall good place
text: we just stopped here for a night while driving through. overall the hotel was fine, about what I would expect. our room was nice and clean, unfortunately we were near the ice machine and laundry room. should have asked to be moved but I'm a pretty sound sleeper and didn't think it would be too much of a problem. wrong! the room door let in every noise and conversation in the hall. especially unhappy since I'm a Wyndham rewards member and should have been given a better room in the first place

title: dirty towel in bathroom/charge for airport shuttle
text: Room was OK but no fridge. Appeared clean until I shut the bathroom door and found a used towel hanging on the hook behind the door - yuck! Also quite disappointed that I had to pay for the shuttle to the airport. For each person. If you're advertising as an "airport" hotel, most folks are expecting a complimentary shuttle to the terminal. Also shuttle stopped running at 10:30pm. Desk staff gave me a number for a taxi service they have fixed price arrangement with, to take me from rental car return to hotel. Called the number, waited 1/2 hour until finally taking airport shuttle back to terminal and catching taxi there.
